org.ingatan.image
Class ImageUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.ingatan.image.ImageUtils

public class ImageUtils
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains some methods used by the image editor as well as some common IO operations (save/load image, etc.). Nothing special here. Clipboard stuf...

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham

setBoundsToAspectRatio

public static java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D setBoundsToAspectRatio(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D bounds,
                                                               double aspectRatio)
Creates a rectangle describing the closest bounds that fit the given aspect ratio, based on the specified bounds. The bounds are corrected by increasing either the height or width.

Parameters:
bounds - the bounds to be corrected.
aspectRatio - the aspect ratio to which the given bounds should be corrected.
Returns:
the corrected bounds with an aspect ratio equal to that provided.

floodFill

public static void floodFill(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             java.awt.Color colourToReplace,
                             java.awt.Color newColour,
                             int tolerance)
Flood fills an area with the specified newColour. This flood fill is 4-way, not 8, so diagonal lines of a different colour to colourToReplace will stop the flood fill.

Parameters:
img - the image upon which the flood fill should occur.
x - the x coordinate of the base point of the flood fill (i.e. where the user clicked)
y - the y coordinate of the base point of the flood fill (i.e. where the user clicked)
colourToReplace - the colour to replace (the colour of pixel (x,y) of img)
newColour - the colour to flood this area with.
tolerance - the tolerance used for the colourIsSimilar method.

colourIsSimilar

public static boolean colourIsSimilar(int col1,
                                      int col2,
                                      java.awt.Color notCol,
                                      int tolerance)
Tests the similarity of the two specified colours by finding the distance between their RGB values in 3D space. If the distance is less than the specified tolerance, then the result is true.

Parameters:
col1 - the RGB value of the first colour.
col2 - the RGB value of the second colour.
notCol - if colour 1 is equal to this colour, then the method will return false. This may be set to null if this feature is not required.
tolerance - the longest distance between the colours that will still allow the method to return true.
Returns:
true if the distance between the colours in 3D space is less than the specified tolerance.

getRGBFromPoint

public static int getRGBFromPoint(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                  java.awt.Point point)
Convenience method which returns the value from the BufferedImage's getRGB method, by using the parameters point.getX() and point.getY().

Parameters:
img - the image from which the RGB value should be taken
point - the coordinate of the pixel whose RGB value we want
Returns:
the RGB value of the pixel at the specified point

imageContainsPoint

public static boolean imageContainsPoint(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                         int x,
                                         int y)
Checks whether the given point exists within the images bounds.

Parameters:
img - the image of interest.
x - the x coordinate of the point to check.
y - the y cooridnate of the point to check.
Returns:
whether or not (x,y) exists within the image bounds.

floodFill

public static void floodFill(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                             java.awt.Point point,
                             java.awt.Color fillColour,
                             int tolerance)
Convenience method for the flood fill method which does not require the 'old' colour to be specified.

Parameters:
img - the image upon which the flood fill should occur.
point - the base point of the flood fill (i.e. where the user clicked)
fillColour - the colour to fill the area with
tolerance - the tolerance as used by the colourIsSimilar method.

getSubImage

public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSubImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage imgParent,
                                                       java.awt.Shape shapeSubImage,
                                                       java.awt.Color background)
returns the sub image of imgParent specified by the Shape shapeSubImage. Regardless of the shape, the subimage will actually be the bounds of the shape. Any image that lays outside of the shape, but within the shape's bounds will be painted with the background colour specified.

Parameters:
imgParent - the image to take the sub image from.
shapeSubImage - the shape defining what area of the parent image that the sub image should contain.
background - the background colour to paint any image area laying between the bounds of the shape and the shape itself.
Returns:
the sub image from imgParent contained by the shapeSubImage shape.

                                        java.awt.Color toReplace)
Sets all pixels of the specified colour to tranpsarent.

Parameters:
image - the image which should have its pixels replaced.
toReplace - the colour which should be replaced by transparency.

Parameters:
img - the image on which to replace the colour.
area - the area in which the colour should be replaced.
oldColour - the colour to replace.
newColour - the colour to replace the old colour.

getAngleBetweenLines

public static double getAngleBetweenLines(java.awt.Point origin,
                                          java.awt.Point vector1,
                                          java.awt.Point vector2)
Returns the angle formed by the points: vector1,origin,vector2. Which is the angle between the lines vector1 and vector2. The origin is the common point shared by these two lines, so each line is: (origin, vector1), and (origin, vector2).

Parameters:
origin - the common point shared by both lines.
vector1 - the point representing the first line (origin, vector1).
vector2 - the point representing the second line (origin, vector2).
Returns:
the angle formed by the points: vector 1, origin, vector2.

setArrowAlongLine

public static java.awt.geom.Path2D setArrowAlongLine(Arrow2D arrowIn,
                                                     java.awt.geom.Line2D line)
The Arrow2D class does not support arrow rotation, only horizontal, right facing arrows. This method rotates an instance of Arrow2D, and translates and scales it so that it sits along the line that has been provided.

Parameters:
arrowIn - the arrow to be resized
line - the line which sets the bounds for the rotate/scaling of the arrow. The arrow head will be placed at point 2 of the line (x2,y2), the end point.
Returns:
a Path2D instance representing the rotated/scaled line geometry.

makeLineStraight

public static java.awt.geom.Line2D makeLineStraight(double x1,
                                                    double y1,
                                                    double x2,
                                                    double y2,
                                                    double threshold,
                                                    boolean performOperation)
Adjusts the coordinates of this line so that the line is rounded to the nearest 45 degree angle.

Parameters:
x1 - x coordinate of point 1 of the line
y1 - y coordinate of point 1 of the line
x2 - x cooridnate of point 2 of the line
y2 - y coordinate of point 2 of the line
performOperation - whether or not the operation should be performed. If this value is false, then this method returns the line that was described by (x1,y1)->(x2,y2). This is a convenience field which means you do not have to specify two line construction statements, one for straight, and one for normal line drawing.
Returns:
the straight version of line iff performOperation is true, otherwise returns the line represented by (x1,y1)->(x2,y2).

mouseRectToLogicalRect

public static java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D mouseRectToLogicalRect(java.awt.Point point1,
                                                               java.awt.Point point2,
                                                               boolean makeBoundsSquare)
When drawing a shape using the mouse, the user may draw rectangular bounds for the shape that have negative widths or heights. This method corrects such a rectangle so that widths and heights are positive. It does this by swapping the x,y and width,height points were neccessary.

The method can adjust further and ensure that the bounds are square. This is done by setting makeBoundsSquare.

The bounds are made square by finding the average side length, and setting this length as the width and height. If point 2 is not below and to the right of point 1, then x and y of point 2 must be offset by the change in the height/width of the bounds. This is because point 2 is the mobile point, and the desired predictable behaviour of drawing a shape from a point to a point will not be acheived if point 1 moves.

Parameters:
point1 - the point which currently represents the location of the bounds
point2 - the point which currently represents the width and height relative to point 1
makeBoundsSquare - whether or not the method should also modify the bounds so that it is square
Returns:
the modified bounds

setImageToClipboard

public static void setImageToClipboard(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
Copies the specified image to the clipboard with the imageFlavor data flavor. It may not be possible for this data to be pasted in all other applications.

Parameters:
img - the image to be copied to the clipboard.

getImageFromClipboard

public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImageFromClipboard(boolean stringToImage,
                                                                 boolean urlToImage)
                                                          throws java.awt.datatransfer.UnsupportedFlavorException,
                                                                 java.io.IOException
Gets the current image from the clipboard. If the clipboard currently holds text, this will be rendered to a buffered image first, in the defualt font. To specify the font, use the getImageFromClipboard(Font font) method.

Parameters:
stringToImage - Whether or not a string data flavour should be converted into an image and returned. true if any string data on the clipboard should be drawn as an image and returned, false to do nothing with string data.
urlToImage - if the data on the clipboard is string flavour, and this flag is true, the method will attempt to pull the image resource from the provided URL.
Returns:
returns the image currently held by the clipboard, or the render of the current clipboard text.
Throws:
java.awt.datatransfer.UnsupportedFlavorException
java.io.IOException

                                java.lang.String filename,
                                java.awt.Component parent)
Save the given image to the file system

Parameters:
image - the image to save.
Returns:
true if the file has been saved successfully.

                                                     java.awt.Component parent)
Load an image from the specified file.

Parameters:
filename - the filename of the image to load.
Returns:
the BufferedImage containing the loaded image.
